title: Introducing: Patrick Daugherty
content:
The internet has opened up limitless possibilities when it comes to the transferring of data, be it photographs, documents or in this case, music.

It scares me somewhat to think that much of the music I write about is produced by people I will most likely never meet or even have any contact with; daunting and beauteous at the same time. So, here you go Patrick Daugherty, I’m writing about your music.

Hailing from Jacksonville, Florida, I presume that Patrick Daugherty’s music is entirely a solo venture, with his new release Conscience being his debut outing (another assumption). It’s a hugely appealing collection of deeply personal tracks, ranging from Why-esque folk-rap (The Passage Of Rip Van Winkle) to piano led instrumental ballad (Prospering Emotions). The production is purposefully raw, yet it goes without saying that due to the nature of the tracks, they benefit from minimal tampering.

Daughterty really excels on the release’s final two tracks, with I Don’t Know slipping in somewhere between modern pop and 00’s American indie and the instrumental closer Prospering Emotions showcasing the singer at his most refined. It’s a collection of tracks full of immense promise, and definitely a work for Daugherty to take pride in and for us to admire. Check out The Passage Of Rip Van Winkle below, and grab the full release from his bandcamp.
